strapiPost.title: Things Are Looking Prehistoric At The Benton County Fairgrounds
strapiPost.content:
The dino-themed family adventure Jurrasic Empire is coming to the Benton County Fairgrounds this weekend on May 6-7, transforming the space into a prehistoric landscape where kids can explore and play.

  • Through the ages: Featuring various fun and educational activities, the exhibit leads guests on a journey through the Jurassic and Ice Age periods highlighting the dinosaurs and mammals that ruled the earth more than 150m years ago.
  • Dino-ride: Kids of all ages can view over 50 life-size realistic dinosaurs in their natural habitat and even ride a 12-foot animatronic T Rex and Triceratops along with other hands-on interactions like a fossil dig, 9D virtual reality rides, and a Jurassic-themed bounce house.

Tickets are priced at $25 and can be found HERE.
